Waterbear Field School

Hands-on community workshops teaching energy, water, food, shelter, climate, communication, fabrication, transport, arts & crafts.

Want to take a class? Or teach a class? Please reach out!

info@waterbearfieldschool.org

Foundations

Waterbear Field School organizes learning around eight foundations - the essential systems that sustain households and communities. Each foundation contains workshops ranging from accessible introductions to advanced builds. Take them individually, or join a Resilience Sequence to work through multiple foundations with a cohort.

Air

Understanding and improving indoor air quality through monitoring and filtration.

Arts & Crafts

Creative expression through hands-on making. Wire sculpture, textiles, and artistic projects.

Communication

How do we stay connected off-grid? Mesh networks, radio, and infrastructure-independent communication.

Energy

How do we generate and store power? Local, DIY approaches to electrical, heat, and gravitational energy.

Fabrication

How do we make and repair things? Welding, casting, metalwork, and repair skills.

Food

How do we grow, preserve, and cook food? Small-scale gardening, season extension, and preservation.

Heating/Cooling

How do we heat and cool spaces off-grid? Low-energy approaches to thermal comfort.

Shelter

How do we build and maintain structures? Carpentry, framing, and DIY construction.

Transport

How do we move people and goods? Bikes, trailers, and human-scale transportation.

Water

How do we collect, store, and purify water? DIY approaches to water independence.

Ready to dive deeper?

The Resilience Sequence is a 4-week cohort program covering energy, climate, communication, and making.

Learn about the Sequence
